comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: BECKER'S LAWYERS PLAN FINAL MOVE; Application for Federal Writ of Habeas Corpus Discussed with Condemned Man's Wife. PETITION IS NOT STARTED Letter Received by H.T. Marshall from Judge Bartlett Submitted to Counsel. Mrs. Charles Becker had a long conference yesterday afternoon with her husband's lawyers, W. Bourke Cochran, Martin T. Manton and John B. Johnston, in relation to final stops in the fight to save her husband from paying the death penalty for the murder of Herman Rosenthal. New York Times - July 13, 1915 Source: select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0615FE385B1773... I started an entry in Wikipedia to try and explain the case: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Becker-Rosenthal_trial

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Cockran spelled his name "Cockran," not "Cochran," but the NYT apparently did not pick up on that fact.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The Bain photo agency also misspelled Cockran's name. Cockran is on the right in this photo, taken in 1912 when he was a Bull Moose Party candidate for Congress in New York:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2515739229/]
